Article.ArticleTitle: Application of Selected Nanomaterials and Ozone in Modern Clinical Dentistry.

AbstractText: This review is an attempt to summarize current research on ozone, titanium dioxide (TiO<sub>2</sub>), silver (Ag), copper oxide CuO and platinum (Pt) nanoparticles (NPs). These agents can be used in various fields of dentistry such as conservative dentistry, endodontic, prosthetic or dental surgery. Nanotechnology and ozone can facilitate the dentist's work by providing antimicrobial properties to dental materials or ensuring a decontaminated work area. However, the high potential of these agents for use in medicine should be confirmed in further research due to possible side effects, especially in long duration of observation so that the best way to apply them can be obtained.
